<extra_id_0> p21ras <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is activated by the T cell antigen receptor ( TCR ) and then co-ordinates important signaling pathways for T lymphocyte activation .

Effector pathways for this guanine nucleotide binding protein in T cells are mediated by the serine / threonine kinase <extra_id_0> Raf-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and the Ras-related GTPase <extra_id_0> Rac-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
In fibroblasts , an important effector for the Ras oncogene is Phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase ( PtdIns 3-kinase ) .

Activation of this lipid kinase is able to induce critical <extra_id_0> Rac-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signaling pathways and can couple <extra_id_0> p21ras <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to cell survival mechanisms via the serine / threonine kinase <extra_id_0> Akt <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> PKB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
The role of PtdIns 3-kinase in Ras signaling in T cells has not been explored .
In the present study , we examined the ability of PtdIns 3-kinase to initiate the <extra_id_0> Rac-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signaling pathways important for T cell activation .
We also examined the possibility that <extra_id_0> Akt <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> PKB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is regulated by Ras signaling pathways in T lymphocytes .
The results show that Ras can initiate a <extra_id_0> Rac-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mediated pathway that regulates the transcriptional function of AP-1 complexes .
PtdIns 3-kinase signals can not mimic <extra_id_0> p21ras <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and induce the Rac mediated responses of AP-1 transcriptional activation .
Moreover , neither TCR or Ras activation of AP-1 is dependent on PtdIns 3-kinase .

<extra_id_0> PKB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is activated in response to triggering of the T cell antigen receptor ; PtdIns 3-kinase activity is both required and sufficient for this TCR response .

text: The present data thus highlight that PtdIns 3-kinase and <extra_id_0> Akt <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> PKB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> are not universal Ras effector molecules .
Ras can initiate <extra_id_0> Rac-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> regulated signaling pathways in the context of T cell antigen receptor function independently of PtdIns 3-kinase activity .
